summary: Phase 5 analysis complete: Discovered fundamental theorem flaw. The theorem maximal_implies_total may be false - Lindenbaum extension can create MCS that block future extensions. Additionally, the previous commit introduced build errors in extensionSeed_consistent proof. Recommending either controlled Lindenbaum approach or pivot to DovetailingChain.

artifacts.summary: Detailed implementation summary covering Phases 1-4 completion, Decision Checkpoint, and remaining work
Updated implementation plan with Phase 4 and Decision Checkpoint marked complete

blockers.description: maximal_implies_total may be false: standard Lindenbaum can create MCS containing formulas like {H p, neg p} that block extension at upper boundaries
blockers.evidence: Counterexample: Family with domain {0,2}, mcs(0) contains G(H p), mcs(2) contains {H p, neg p}. At boundary t=3, controlled seed contains {H p, P(neg p)} which is inconsistent.
resolution_options: Use controlled Lindenbaum that avoids adding blocking formulas
Prove domains are intervals (no internal gaps)

blockers.description: Previous commit (75e99ab6) introduced compilation errors in extensionSeed_consistent proof
blockers.details: List.mem_cons_self usage errors and malformed induction hypotheses
blockers.fix: Use existing GContent_union_contained_at_max and HContent_union_contained_at_min lemmas instead of inline induction

metadata.analysis_summary: The h_G_from_new and h_H_from_new sorries in maximal_implies_total cannot be filled because the underlying theorem may be false. At boundary times where s_future is arbitrary (not minimum HContent source), the proof fails for HContent elements with source < s_future. More fundamentally, Lindenbaum extension is non-deterministic and can choose MCS that syntactically contain {H p, neg p} which blocks coherent extension.

completion_data.completion_summary: Phase 5 analysis identified fundamental flaw in maximal_implies_total theorem. Standard Lindenbaum can create MCS that block future extensions. Build errors also found in previous commit. Requires either controlled Lindenbaum implementation or DovetailingChain pivot.
